thread.title: Report: Kauffman Stadium has worst mobile service in MLB
thread.title_full: Report: Kauffman Stadium has worst mobile service in MLB - KCTV5

author: Chris Oberholtz, Multimedia Producer
title: Report: Kauffman Stadium has worst mobile service in MLB
text:
KANSAS CITY, MO (KCTV) - With the Royals in the midst of another run to the World Series, fans at Kauffman Stadium have been eager to share their postseason experiences while watching a game.
However, some fans may not be having easiest time when it comes to posting pictures and video to Facebook or tweeting about a big play.
According to a recent report from RootMetrics , Kauffman Stadium has the worst mobile data performance among all the United States ballparks in Major League Baseball.
Kauffman Stadium finished in 29th place while Boston’s Fenway Park was the top-ranked stadium.
Sprint was the top performing carrier at Kauffman Stadium showing "excellent reliability" and also the "fastest median download and upload speeds" at 14.6 Mbps and 3.8 Mbps, respectively, the report states.
However, the three other carriers "struggled with speed and only Verizon was able to show strong performance when it came to data reliability," according to RootMetrics.
The Royals take exception to the report.
"Data connectivity at stadiums is provided by a combination of cellular data and wifi data. To say we are “last” is not understanding the subject matter, nor is it asking the fans that have been to our venue over the past two seasons anything about their experience," said Brian Himstedt, Senior Director-Information Systems for the Royals.
Himstedt also says that Sprint, which has a major investment at Kauffman Stadium, is ranked well. The other three carriers, which are not sponsors, are ranked poorly. That, Himstedt says, is the reason the Royals rated last.
"Carriers choose their investments market by market, and there is only so much influence we have on the level of investment they make in Kansas City vs. another metro area.  Obviously, we will make the continue to work with MLB and all the carriers to bring the best overall experience to our fans point," Himstedt said.
According to the report, Verizon was the highest ranking carrier overall, winning or sharing the overall award at 15 of the MLB stadiums.
The report also stated that Pittsburgh’s PNC Park was the top-ranked stadium among the nine U.S. postseason teams, finishing sixth.
